lead_paragraph: An environmental group says eight large oil companies have been negligent in using a gasoline additive that has contaminated more than 10,000 groundwater sites in California. The group, Communities for a Better Environment, said in a lawsuit filed on Thursday that the companies had known of the dangers of the additive, M.T.B.E., which was developed in the 1970's to allow fuel to burn cleanly. It asked a California Superior Court judge to ban the use of M.T.B.E. and require the companies to pay for cleaning the state's drinking water.
